Audio Description: This poster urges citizens to conserve food during wartime. At the top of the poster is the message “Choose for Victory.” The word “Victory” is in large red type. In the center of the poster is a menu that cast a shadow on a green surface with a large red “V” on it. A black arrow points to the “V” with the words “Victory Dish” in white letters. At the bottom of the menu is the message “Go Easy With Bread.” Beneath the menu is the text that reads” “V on the menu means Victory Dish --- a special dish made at the suggestion of the Minister of Food. It is composed of ship savers such as potatoes and other fresh vegetables, dried egg, cheese.” In a slim red banner running across the bottom of the poster are the words: “Try a V dish today.”
